verses.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;
So that thou incline thy ear to wisdom, \add and\add* apply thy heart to understanding;
Yes, if thou criest after knowledge, \add and\add* liftest up thy voice for understanding;
If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as \add for\add* hid treasures;
Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.
For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth \add cometh\add* knowledge and understanding.
He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: \add he is\add* a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; \add and\add* every good path.
When wisdom entereth into thy heart, and knowledge is pleasant to thy soul;
Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:
To deliver thee from the way of the evil \add man\add* , from the man that speaketh froward things;
Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
Who rejoice to do evil, \add and\add* delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
Whose ways \add are\add* crooked, and \add they\add* froward in their paths:
To deliver thee from the strange woman, \add even\add* from the stranger \add who\add* flattereth with her words;
Who forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
For her house inclineth to death, and her paths to the dead.
None that go to her return again, neither do they take hold of the paths of life.
That thou mayest walk in the way of good \add men\add* , and keep the paths of the righteous.
For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
